TopicTitle: A whole galaxy for all kerbalkind

Articles.Content:
Hey guys i am starting a new mod that incorporates starsystems, planetfactory CE, And texturereplacer, And some other things.

I do need a little help, I need someone to help me add a galactic dust ring, And some nebulas, Nebulas only have to be a small star or planet wrapped in a gigantic particle cloud, I also need help incorporating a optional but nice potential feature Wormholes!! I plan to use hyperedit to make it so that when you get too close to a black hole you will be teleported into a escape trajectory from a random black somewhere else in the universe!

Here is a screenshot:

License

Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0)

Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0)

License for Planetfactory CE

https://github.com/Kragrathea/PlanetFactory

Thanks to the developers of all the mods listed above for making the tool i am using to do this

Can people please send me some planets for each star

Planet Requirements:

#1: most of them have to be close to mun size.

#2: Feel free to get exotic about it because it is interstellar travel.

The Kerbal galaxy

will consist of:

1 Yellow stars

1 Blue dwarfs

1 Blue Giants

2 Red dwarfs

1 Red Hypergiant!! "Literally the radius is the size of the kerbol system alone!!"

Edited February 6, 2015 by daniel l.
Nerfing amount of stars

I'm sorry, but that amount of stars (and if you plan to put atleast 1 planet in each star's orbit) is practically impossible to run. I have trouble using StarSystems with any more than 8 stars. Interesting, nonetheless.
I am willing to reduce i just learned the same thing:sticktongue:
Figure I should point out that Planetfactory is pretty much depreciated at this point. No one uses it due to the amount of ram it takes up for planets. Kopernicus is the way to go.
I have not used either, but I can only imagine the stress on my system (shudders)
I like kopernicus too but starsystems doesnt like it
Out of curiosity, what star is in the background of that screenshot? The red dwarf, maybe?

Its corbo one of the default stars in starsystems

And the planet is joker from the serious system.

This is a great idea.

Unfortunately StarSystems does not work with the new ModuleManager or Kopernicus, and PFCE is a dead mod.
I'm trying to see if i can get PFCE to do one last thing. It deserves a final bit of publicity, And it is the only one that can do it, Can you help me make a galactic disc?

I'm trying to see if i can get PFCE to do one last thing. It deserves a final bit of publicity, And it is the only one that can do it, Can you help me make a galactic disc?

No thank you.

And use quotes, please.

Crazy idea just thought of seconds ago: what if we could implement interstellar gas to give the "look" of an entire galaxy. The gas could be a lot in the way EVE does clouds, in that simple 2D images are scattered about over a plane and that they always face you. Space Engine, in fact, does something very similar (heck, it could be the same method), and the results are always jaw-dropping.

Of course, this is by no means a request for this mod. Just a little tidbit to get you guys' brains thinking.

EDIT: Woops, that's what this mod is all about.

Wow you took the right out of my mouth

Great minds think alike! Also, I want to mess around and see if I can get anything that looks good. Right now I have a question posted on the EVE thread asking how to create clouds around the sun. Fingers crossed for a rapid response.

Me too i am trying to make a central bulge around the black hole out of EVE clouds,

Update:

It doesnt seem to work, I need help

Update:

Dang. I have no idea what to do, and to be honest I'm not in the mood to do modding right now.
We should get help from the guy who made the gargantua mod

Daniel, currently planet mods are in a bit of a mess. PFCE might be back from the dead, Krag made a beta version for 0.90. Kopernicus development has resumed, Kittopia development has stopped (but will probably be restarted under new ownership), and there are a few packs out there that try to put them together (KopernicusTech is the most current).

Kopernicus is not compatible with Star Systems so it wouldn't work for what you're trying to do. EVE clouds are in spheres, not bulges or rings. Try Kittopia's ring feature?

I know I'm trying to use the EVE sphere clouds to make a central bulge (Which would be spherical) And as for kittopia rings, I need help learning about transform value because i cant even make planet rings!

Hey guys here is some further information on my upcoming pack!

Dolas' Planets are currently in development here are their specs:

Gini:

Radius: 600km

Gravity: 0.8g

Fun fact: Pretty close to dolas, It has yellow patches here and there

Dera: (Featured in the banner.)

A big blue gas giant.

Moons:

Fleth:

Radius: 600km

Gravity: 0.2g

Herodux:

Radius: 60km

Gravity: 0.05g

Karchus:

Radius: 60km

Gravity: 0.23g

I hope you like the info above, Sorry if i am not giving all the info you would like but i am trying to be able to dramatically unveil it

Mods Required: Texturereplacer, Starsystems, Planetfactory CE,

( I know PFCE is outdated but i can do this with anything else. )

BTW: I would be interested in porting this over to kopernicustech but i dont have 0.90 (It doesnt work on my pc right now.) but i am going to need help.

Duplicate threads merged. If you'd like to change the thread title, edit the post, click the Go Advanced button, change the title, and save.

Regarding some removed posts, please remember to keep your posts polite and on-topic and avoid backseat moderation. Hit the report button and then don't post about it.

Regarding some removed posts, please remember to keep your posts polite and on-topic and avoid backseat moderation. Hit the report button and then don't post about it.

I created a seperate thread because i thought that the original thread informed on what i was going to do and the new thread was supposed to inform on what i was already doing.

There's no need to clutter the forums with multiple development threads for the same mod. Please edit the first post, instead.

I can promise you all that version 0.1 will be out by monday! (Its friday where i am )
